alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:11PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Ulster County through 845 PM EDT... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hurley to near High Falls to near Kerhonkson. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...This system is producing brief, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall could lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... New Paltz, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Tillson, Napanoch, Wawarsing, Esopus, Rosendale, Marbletown, Maple Hill, Fantinekill, Stone Ridge, Honk Hill, Cottekill, Lackawack, Plutarch, Kallops Corners, Lyonsville, Union Center and Butterville. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
